intro: Millettia chenkangensis, commonly known as the Ch'enkang millettia, is a rare leguminous plant native to China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its seeds are encased in pods and are an important food source for certain wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
